choices.D: VTP does not support extended VLANs.
choices.C: The VTP feature has been disabled.
choices.A: The VTP passwords are set incorrectly,
choices.B: The VTP domain names do not match.

discussion.content:
To see the VTP mode, domain name and MD5 password configured:

show vtp status

Also, show vtp password will also show the password.

questions.answer_description:
The VTP passwords are set incorrectly.
Use the show VTP password command, one side is set to cisco the other is cisco123.

5
Use the show vlan command to see the number of VLANs configured in the 1006-4094 range.

discussion.content:
In the output of show vtp status is the field "Number of existing extended VLANs.

Also, to use extended VLANs, you must be running VTPv3 (the version of VTP you're running is also shown in the output of this command). So, if the output doesn't show v3, then it better not show any extended VLANs either.

I'm assuming they logged into the switch and executed the command "show interface trunk". Here's an example output:

show interface trunk
Port Mode Encapsulation Status Native vlan
Fa0/1 on 802.1q
Fa0/3 on 802.1q trunking 99
Port Vlans allowed on trunk
Fa0/1 10,20,99 --> in this case, these are the only vlans allowed on the trunk

choices.C: This VLAN range is not allowed on E2/11.
choices.D: LACP is not running on E2/11.
choices.A: STP (Rapid PVST) is not running on E2/11.
choices.B: VTP is not enabled on E2/11.

questions.answer_description:
This VLAN range is not allowed on E2/11
Use the "show interface trunk" to see the VLANs allowed on the E2/11 interface. The 750-760 VLAN ranges are not included.

discussion.content: What does the output look like when you have multiple VLANs? Is it pretty easy to tell from the output which bridge is root for a given vlan?

questions.answer_description:
99, 750-759, 990, 1006-1010
Use the "show spanning tree" command to see which switch is the root for each VLAN.
N7010-C1 will reply to ARPs that are received on Vlan11

choices.B: Vlan11 belongs to the virtual routing and forwarding group 244.0.0.2
choices.D: Vlan11 will forward broadcast packets with the destionation address 10.1.11.255
choices.A: N7020-C1 will reply to ARPs that are received on Vlan11.

discussion.content: It will reply to arp because IP Proxy arp is enabled.

B is wrong. 224.0.0.2 is a multicast address and has nothing to do with VRFs. Besides, near the top it says "IP Interface statu for VRF
 default". 
 
C is wrong. Near the top is shows the mask to be a /24 (not /32).

D is wrong. About mid-way down it shows IP directed-broadcast is disabled.
